channel.title: Bootstrapped #117: Selling to Developers
channel.description:
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/e2b0170d-1e03-4205-ba5c-1e77d0c56100?dark=false"></iframe>
Ed from [OpenCage Geocoder](https://opencagedata.com/) and I talk about the marketing techniques that work - and don't work - when you product is targeted towards developers.
Thanks to Balsamiq who sponsored this episode. Find out how, thanks to Balsamiq, [you can promote your bootstrapped business for free on the podcast](https://balsamiq.com/go/bootstrapped/).
Our guest sponsor, courtesy of Balsamiq, is [Easy Data Transform](https://www.easydatatransform.com/).

item.title: Bootstrapped #117: Selling to Developers
item.dc:creator: David
item.description:
Hoping not to fall into a ‘slow chat’ here, I’m looking forward to that!

Read full topic

item.title: Bootstrapped #117: Selling to Developers
item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
@David you might be interested in knowing that in the next episode (already recorded) we talk a little about AnyRail

Read full topic

item.title: Bootstrapped #117: Selling to Developers
item.dc:creator: David
item.description:
Thanks for the download link.

Nice episode again. I think that in any target group you’ll find a lot of variation in the skill set and domain knowledge. You’ll always be surprised about the questions the users ask!

Read full topic
